list.name: Changes
list.comment: Implement word count functionality with formatted output

task.summary: - Created a main function to store emails and associated names. - Added input prompts for email and name confirmation. - Included a helper function to extract and format names from email addresses. - Displayed stored emails and names at the end of execution.

- Implemented a dictionary of color names with their corresponding hexadecimal codes. - Created a main function to prompt users for color names and display the associated hex codes. - Included error handling for unrecognized color names. - Allowed users to exit the program by pressing Enter without input.

- Created a dictionary mapping state codes to their full names. - Enabled user input for state codes, allowing case-insensitive entry. - Added validation to check for valid state codes and provide feedback. - Displayed a list of all states and their corresponding names at the end.

- Implemented CSV reading to extract Wimbledon champion data. - Created functions to count wins for each champion and retrieve unique countries. - Displayed sorted lists of champions with their win counts. - Listed unique countries that have won Wimbledon. - Ensured proper handling of CSV file encoding.

- Created a basic Kivy app to demonstrate interactive functionality. - Added buttons dynamically for a list of names and handled their press events. - Implemented a counter with up/down button functionality to update status text. - Utilized Kivy's StringProperty for dynamic updates in the UI. - Set up initial app title and layout using a KV file.

- Defined the layout and widget structure for the Kivy app using KV language. - Configured a vertical BoxLayout containing a Label and two buttons for counter control. - Set up a horizontal BoxLayout for the Up and Down buttons to modify the counter. - Included an id for the names_box to allow dynamic addition of name buttons from the Python code.

- Added a function to count occurrences of each word in a user-provided string. - Utilized a dictionary for counting and sorted the results alphabetically. - Formatted output for aligned display based on the longest word. - Included user input handling and case normalization.
Add email and name storage functionality
Fix color lookup and enhance user input handling
Add interactive buttons and counter functionality in Kivy app
Define UI layout in Kv file for Kivy app
Implement state code lookup and input validation
Implement word count functionality with formatted output

MESSAGE.value: - Created a main function to store emails and associated names. - Added input prompts for email and name confirmation. - Included a helper function to extract and format names from email addresses. - Displayed stored emails and names at the end of execution.

- Implemented a dictionary of color names with their corresponding hexadecimal codes. - Created a main function to prompt users for color names and display the associated hex codes. - Included error handling for unrecognized color names. - Allowed users to exit the program by pressing Enter without input.

- Created a dictionary mapping state codes to their full names. - Enabled user input for state codes, allowing case-insensitive entry. - Added validation to check for valid state codes and provide feedback. - Displayed a list of all states and their corresponding names at the end.

- Implemented CSV reading to extract Wimbledon champion data. - Created functions to count wins for each champion and retrieve unique countries. - Displayed sorted lists of champions with their win counts. - Listed unique countries that have won Wimbledon. - Ensured proper handling of CSV file encoding.

- Created a basic Kivy app to demonstrate interactive functionality. - Added buttons dynamically for a list of names and handled their press events. - Implemented a counter with up/down button functionality to update status text. - Utilized Kivy's StringProperty for dynamic updates in the UI. - Set up initial app title and layout using a KV file.

- Defined the layout and widget structure for the Kivy app using KV language. - Configured a vertical BoxLayout containing a Label and two buttons for counter control. - Set up a horizontal BoxLayout for the Up and Down buttons to modify the counter. - Included an id for the names_box to allow dynamic addition of name buttons from the Python code.

- Added a function to count occurrences of each word in a user-provided string. - Utilized a dictionary for counting and sorted the results alphabetically. - Formatted output for aligned display based on the longest word. - Included user input handling and case normalization.
Add email and name storage functionality
Fix color lookup and enhance user input handling
Add interactive buttons and counter functionality in Kivy app
Define UI layout in Kv file for Kivy app
Implement state code lookup and input validation
Implement word count functionality with formatted output
